title: Repel Missiles
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Reduces the chance of projectile attacks striking the caster, making them easier to dodge. Single-target attacks are much easier to repel than penetrating attacks. |

**Repel Missiles** (**RMsl**, **repulsion**) is a passive effect and monster-only spell which causes ranged attacks to miss the caster.

## Contents

- [1 Effect](#Effect)
- [2 Player sources](#Player_sources)
- [3 Monster Version](#Monster_Version)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 References](#References)

## Effect

Creatures with Repel Missiles have +15 [EV](/EV "EV") against ranged attacks, including spells.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) This spell only helps to [evade](/Ev "Ev") ranged attacks; it has no effect on the caster's ability to [block](/SH "SH") them.

## Player sources

Though the Repel Missiles spell is no longer available for players, several other sources exist for players to receive the effect:

- [Scarves of repulsion](/Scarf#Egos "Scarf") provide the effect while worn.
- Worshipers of [Qazlal](/Qazlal "Qazlal") will eventually acquire a permanent Repel Missiles effect, as long as they maintain enough [piety](/Piety "Piety").
- [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") with the [Repulsion Field](/Repulsion_Field "Repulsion Field") mutation will eventually develop a permanent repel missiles effect.
- The [Amulet of the Air](/Amulet_of_the_Air "Amulet of the Air") is an unrandart amulet that produces a permanent repel missiles effect.

## Monster Version

The following enemies cast Repel Missiles:

- e [![Deep elf archer.png](/images/c/c0/Deep_elf_archer.png)](/File:Deep_elf_archer.png) **[Deep elf archer](/Deep_elf_archer "Deep elf archer")**
- e [![Deep elf elementalist.png](/images/7/7b/Deep_elf_elementalist.png)](/File:Deep_elf_elementalist.png) **[Deep elf elementalist](/Deep_elf_elementalist "Deep elf elementalist")**
- Q [![Sojobo.png](/images/6/66/Sojobo.png)](/File:Sojobo.png) **[Sojobo](/Sojobo "Sojobo")**
- i [![Spriggan air mage.png](/images/c/cd/Spriggan_air_mage.png)](/File:Spriggan_air_mage.png) **[Spriggan air mage](/Spriggan_air_mage "Spriggan air mage")**
- i [![The Enchantress.png](/images/8/8f/The_Enchantress.png)](/File:The_Enchantress.png) **[The Enchantress](/The_Enchantress "The Enchantress")**
- k [![Wind drake.png](/images/b/b7/Wind_drake.png)](/File:Wind_drake.png) **[Wind drake](/Wind_drake "Wind drake")**

In addition, the following enemies provide a Repel Missiles aura:

- v [![Polterguardian.png](/images/a/a2/Polterguardian.png)](/File:Polterguardian.png) **[Polterguardian](/Polterguardian "Polterguardian")**

Unlike the player version, the monster version can be [dispelled](/Potion_of_cancellation "Potion of cancellation").

Monsters with Repel Missiles will start with the status permanently active, meaning they never have to cast the spell unless the status is dispelled.

## Strategy

Repel Missiles is effective at blocking ranged attacks, from [centaurs](/List_of_centaurs "List of centaurs") and [fauns](/Faun "Faun") with ranged weapons to [bolt spells](/Bolt_spell "Bolt spell") and [crystal spears](/Crystal_spear "Crystal spear"). AC can't block special effects, like [Stunning Burst](/Stunning_Burst "Stunning Burst") paralysis and [Throw Klown Pie](/Throw_Klown_Pie "Throw Klown Pie"), but these spells can be repelled or dodged. It's great in [the Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals"), the [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls"), [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), and other areas infested with enemies who love to shoot at you.

Monsters with Repel Missiles are few and far between. As you would expect, trying to hit them with a ranged attack will be quite difficult. They are still vulnerable to [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") and hex [wands](/Wand "Wand"), though most users have a high [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") to counteract that. And of course, things that don't miss -- like [Borgnjor's Vile Clutch](/Borgnjor%27s_Vile_Clutch "Borgnjor's Vile Clutch"), [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball"), and [lightning rods](/Lightning_rod "Lightning rod") -- are unaffected.

[Yara's Violent Unravelling](/Yara%27s_Violent_Unravelling "Yara's Violent Unravelling") or a [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver") can be used to dispel a monster's Repel Missiles.

## History

| [![Repel missiles.png](/images/b/bd/Repel_missiles.png)](/File:Repel_missiles.png) Repel Missiles |                                                                                                             |
| :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Level                                                                                             | 2                                                                                                           |
| School1                                                                                           | [Air](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                                                                               |
| School2                                                                                           | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                                                                                  |
| Source(s)                                                                                         | [Book of Air](/Book_of_Air "Book of Air") [Book of Minor Magic](/Book_of_Minor_Magic "Book of Minor Magic") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                       | 1                                                                                                           |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                         | 0                                                                                                           |

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), Repel Missiles reduced the to-hit of ranged attacks against the caster from 0-100% if single-target or 50-100% if penetrating. Also, it didn't work on incapacitated targets.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), a more advanced version of Repel Missiles called [Deflect Missiles](/Deflect_Missiles "Deflect Missiles") existed. Monsters with DMsl instead got Repel Missiles.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), Repel Missiles was a level 2 [Air](/Air "Air")/[Charms](/Charms "Charms") spell available to players; it expired as it helped dodge projectiles. However, other sources still exist.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the Repel Missiles status expired based on a timer.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [fight.cc:107](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.32.0/crawl-ref/source/fight.cc#L107) (0.32.0)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [spl-cast.cc:1488](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.32.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-cast.cc#L1488) (0.32.0)
html:
Repel Missiles

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.
Reduces the chance of projectile attacks striking the caster, making them easier to dodge. Single-target attacks are much easier to repel than penetrating attacks.

Repel Missiles (RMsl, repulsion) is a passive effect and monster-only spell which causes ranged attacks to miss the caster.

Contents

  • 1 Effect
  • 2 Player sources
  • 3 Monster Version
  • 4 Strategy
  • 5 History
  • 6 References

Effect

Creatures with Repel Missiles have +15 EV against ranged attacks, including spells.[1][2] This spell only helps to evade ranged attacks; it has no effect on the caster's ability to block them.

Player sources

Though the Repel Missiles spell is no longer available for players, several other sources exist for players to receive the effect:

  • Scarves of repulsion provide the effect while worn.
  • Worshipers of Qazlal will eventually acquire a permanent Repel Missiles effect, as long as they maintain enough piety.
  • Demonspawn with the Repulsion Field mutation will eventually develop a permanent repel missiles effect.
  • The Amulet of the Air is an unrandart amulet that produces a permanent repel missiles effect.

Monster Version

The following enemies cast Repel Missiles:

  • e Deep elf archer
  • e Deep elf elementalist
  • Q Sojobo
  • i Spriggan air mage
  • i The Enchantress
  • k Wind drake

In addition, the following enemies provide a Repel Missiles aura:

  • v Polterguardian

Unlike the player version, the monster version can be dispelled.

Monsters with Repel Missiles will start with the status permanently active, meaning they never have to cast the spell unless the status is dispelled.

Strategy

Repel Missiles is effective at blocking ranged attacks, from centaurs and fauns with ranged weapons to bolt spells and crystal spears. AC can't block special effects, like Stunning Burst paralysis and Throw Klown Pie, but these spells can be repelled or dodged. It's great in the Shoals, the Elven Halls, the Vaults, and other areas infested with enemies who love to shoot at you.

Monsters with Repel Missiles are few and far between. As you would expect, trying to hit them with a ranged attack will be quite difficult. They are still vulnerable to Hexes and hex wands, though most users have a high willpower to counteract that. And of course, things that don't miss -- like Borgnjor's Vile Clutch, Fireball, and lightning rods -- are unaffected.

Yara's Violent Unravelling or a wand of quicksilver can be used to dispel a monster's Repel Missiles.

History

 Repel Missiles
Level 2
School1 Air
School2 Charms
Source(s) Book of Air
Book of Minor Magic
Casting noise 1
Spell noise 0
  • Prior to 0.32, Repel Missiles reduced the to-hit of ranged attacks against the caster from 0-100% if single-target or 50-100% if penetrating. Also, it didn't work on incapacitated targets.
  • Prior to 0.25, a more advanced version of Repel Missiles called Deflect Missiles existed. Monsters with DMsl instead got Repel Missiles.
  • Prior to 0.20, Repel Missiles was a level 2 Air/Charms spell available to players; it expired as it helped dodge projectiles. However, other sources still exist.
  • Prior to 0.14, the Repel Missiles status expired based on a timer.

References

  1. ↑ fight.cc:107 (0.32.0)
  2. ↑ spl-cast.cc:1488 (0.32.0)

Monsters with Repel Missiles will start with the status permanently active, meaning they never have to cast the spell unless the status is dispelled. ==Strategy== Repel Missiles is effective at blocking ranged attacks, from [[list of centaurs|centaurs]] and [[faun]]s with ranged weapons to [[bolt spell]]s and [[crystal spear]]s. As you would expect, trying to hit them with a ranged attack will be quite difficult. They are still vulnerable to [[Hexes]] and hex [[wand]]s, though most users have a high [[willpower]] to counteract that.
